PASSENGER SELECTION CRITERIA
FOR EXIT SEATING
FEDERAL AVIATION REGULATIONS REQUIRE THAT PASSENGERS SEATED IN AN EXIT SEAT ARE ABLE TO PERFORM
THE EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES AND MEET ALL SELECTION CRITERIA AS LISTED BELOW, AFTER REVIEWING
THIS SAFETY INFORMATION CARD, PLEASE IDENTIFY YOURSELF TO A CREW MEMBER FOR RESEATING IF YOU:

EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES
IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY IN WHICH A CREW MEMBER IS NOT AVAILABLE TO ASSIST.
YOU MAY BE CALLED UPON TO PERFORM THE FOLLOWING DUTIES:
1 Locate the emergency cot.

4 Operate the emergency exit.

SELECTION CRITERIA
YOU MAY NOT SIT IN AN EXIT SEAT IF YOU ARE UNABLE TO PERFORM THE
EMERGENCY EXIT SEAT DUTIES AS DESCRIBE ABOVE BECAUSE:
© To grasp and push, pui, turn, or othenvise manipulate those mechanisms.

and weight of the overwing ext doors.
